entry.title: Homological shifts of polymatroidal ideals
entry.summary: We study the homological shifts of polymatroidal ideals. It is shown that the first homological shift ideal of any polymatroidal ideal is again polymatroidal, supporting a conjecture of Bandari, Bayati and Herzog that predicts that all homological shift ideals of a polymatroidal ideal are polymatroidal. We also study the "socle ideal" $\text{soc}(I)$ of a polymatroidal ideal $I$ and relate it to the highest homological shift ideal of $I$. It is shown that $\text{soc}(I)$ is polymatroidal if: (i) $I$ is a polymatroidal generated in degree two, (ii) $I$ is a polymatroidal ideal in at most three variables, (iii) $I$ is matroidal, (iv) $I$ is a principal Borel ideal, (v) $I$ is a PLP--polymatroidal ideal, (vi) $I$ is a LP--polymatroidal ideal.
